pathAssistantSteps.info:
1. The account is now Active and jobs can be booked against it
  2. Ensure relevant fields are maintained to keep the Account Information up to date and relevant
1. The Account is now Closed and therefore is no longer a trading account.

1. Using the Onboarding case, set up the Account in Oracle and the associated pricing terms
  2. Any additional setup requirements can be added to the Onboarding case as an additional Task, i.e. VRN, Reporting, Glassline etc
  3. Once you are happy that all the necessary Onboarding Tasks have been completed and all the Account Rules have been added, the account can be moved to Active

1. Clients must have submitted an Account Application Form
  2. A Credit Check is performed on the Account to see if we can provide credit facilities and to determine an acceptable credit limit, subject to business approval
  3. Set up required Account Rules ahead of Onboarding

1. Capture as much information as possible about the potential volume of jobs / scope of work
  2. Record information about any Current Suppliers, their share of work and when any existing agreements are likely to come up for renewal
  3. Make sure to log a 'Next Communication Date' when there is not an associated Opportunity, so that you are automatically reminded of when next to make contact

1. The account has been placed on hold, please reach out to Account Maintenance or Customer Accounts for further information
  2. Jobs cannot be booked against an account while it is on hold
